doc.summary: This constructor accepts some capabilities that this block entity will have.
doc.text: This constructor accepts some capabilities that this block entity will have. Just make sure that  the class also implements the required capability types or you might crash the game.

doc.summary: This will update the block entity when on the client using <ref cls="net/minecraft/world/level/block/entity/BlockEntity" method="getUpdateTag" type="()net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag">#getUpdateTag()</ref>  and <ref cls="net/minecraftforge/common/extensions/IForgeBlockEntity" method="handleUpdateTag" type="(net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag)void">#handleUpdateTag(CompoundTag)</ref>.
doc.text: This will update the block entity when on the client using <ref cls="net/minecraft/world/level/block/entity/BlockEntity" method="getUpdateTag" type="()net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag">#getUpdateTag()</ref>  and <ref cls="net/minecraftforge/common/extensions/IForgeBlockEntity" method="handleUpdateTag" type="(net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag)void">#handleUpdateTag(CompoundTag)</ref>.

doc.summary: This will update the block entity to all clients that are tracking it when called on the server  using <ref cls="net/minecraft/world/level/block/entity/BlockEntity" method="getUpdateTag" type="()net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag">#getUpdateTag()</ref> and <ref cls="net/minecraftforge/common/extensions/IForgeBlockEntity" method="handleUpdateTag" type="(net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag)void">#handleUpdateTag(CompoundTag)</ref> at the end of this tick.
doc.text: This will update the block entity to all clients that are tracking it when called on the server  using <ref cls="net/minecraft/world/level/block/entity/BlockEntity" method="getUpdateTag" type="()net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag">#getUpdateTag()</ref> and <ref cls="net/minecraftforge/common/extensions/IForgeBlockEntity" method="handleUpdateTag" type="(net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag)void">#handleUpdateTag(CompoundTag)</ref> at the end of this tick.
A base class for <ref cls="net/minecraft/world/level/block/entity/BlockEntity">block entities</ref>. This provides some useful methods.
